title: Where Every Meal Is a Sacrifice

The goat was a living bounty in this parched city on the Sahara’s edge, providing the sweet milk that filled his family’s stomachs at breakfast time. But as soaring food prices worldwide have hit the poorest nations of Africa the hardest, he has been forced to join many of his neighbors in slaughtering or selling off one of their only sources of wealth — their livestock.

title: Turkey gives anti-pandemic aid to Balkan nations
body: TURKEY yesterday delivered medical supplies to five Balkan countries to help fight the coronavirus outbreak. A Turkish military aircraft carrying supplies that took off from the capital Ankara delivered supplies to Serbia and Bosnia-Herzegovina first. “Masks, overalls and test kits prepared by Turkey’s Health Ministry will be delivered to Serbia, Bosnia-Herzegovina, , North Macedonia and Kosovo at the instruction of our President (Recep Tayyip) Erdoğan,” the Defense Ministry said on Twitter ahead of takeoff. Turkey previously sent medical aid to Italy and Spain, the countries in Europe worst hit by the virus. The crates containing the supplies for the Balkan nations carried the words of the 13th-century Sufi mystic Mevlana Jalaluddin Rumi: “There is hope after despair and many suns after darkness.”
